title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,902.40 USD/T on December 17, 2025, up 0.72% from the previous day, with a 4.07% increase over the past month and 14.81% year-over-year. UK aluminum futures hovered around $2,870 per tonne near a one-month high, supported by improving demand prospects, tight global supply, and China's stimulus measures against its property crisis.

title: [SMM Aluminum Express] Domestic Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventory Down 12,56 mt WoW on Dec 18
summary: Domestic secondary aluminum ingot inventory decreased by 12,56 mt week-over-week on December 18, 2025. SMM expects aluminum prices to mainly hover at highs in the short term.

title: Aluminium Prices Supported By Demand From EVs, Construction & Renewable Energy Sectors
summary: Aluminum prices are being supported by strong demand from electric vehicles (EVs), construction, and renewable energy sectors. The video discusses current market dynamics driving these trends.

title: SMM review of alumina and aluminium production in November and forecast for December 2025
summary: SMM reports China's domestic aluminium capacity at 46.12 million tonnes and operating capacity at 44.225 million tonnes as of end-November 2025. Operating capacity is expected to increase slightly in December with new projects starting late 2025 to early 2026. Alumina market faces oversupply, with operating capacity projected at 88.69 million tonnes amid import pressures and potential production cuts.

title: Vedanta Aluminium scales Lanjigarh Refinery to 5 MTPA
summary: Vedanta Aluminium, India's largest producer, has scaled its Lanjigarh Refinery to 5 million tonnes per annum capacity. This expansion marks a key milestone in the company's growth and bolsters India's self-reliance in aluminium production.

title: Sunstone, EGA to set up JV, building anode facility in UAE
summary: Sunstone and EGA are establishing a joint venture to build a pre-baked anode production facility in the UAE, aimed at replacing most of EGA's current anode imports. Construction starts in Q2 or Q3 2026, with commercial production expected in Q2 or Q3 2028. EGA, the world's largest producer of high-purity aluminum, currently produces 1.35 million tonnes of anodes annually.

title: [SMM Aluminum Express] Domestic Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventory Down 1,256 mt WoW on Dec 18
summary: SMM statistics show social inventory of secondary aluminum ingots in China's mainstream consumption areas at 53,400 mt on December 18, down 1,256 mt week-on-week. This continues a slight destocking trend in the secondary aluminum sector.

title: Norway Begins Production of Recycled Aluminum License Plates
summary: Norway has launched a project to produce license plates from recycled aluminum, promoting sustainability in manufacturing. This initiative marks a significant step in using recycled materials for everyday applications. ALM Intelligence highlights its dedication to industry-leading solutions supporting such innovations.

title: Gov. Beshear: AKFA Aluminum Solutions To Establish New Manufacturing Operation in Bowling Green, Creating 331 Quality Jobs
summary: AKFA Aluminum Solutions is establishing a new manufacturing operation in Bowling Green, Kentucky, creating 331 quality jobs. This development supports aluminum production expansion potentially tied to innovative and sustainable practices. Governor Beshear announced the project as a boost to the local economy.

title: BASF Research Press Briefing 2025: How innovations drive BASF's success
summary: BASF's R&D focuses on green transformation, including innovations like methane pyrolysis that produce high-purity carbon for aluminum production. This technology supports sustainability by providing valuable raw materials for aluminum, steel, and batteries. BASF collaborates with partners like ExxonMobil to optimize these processes.

title: U.S. Recycled Steel Prices Rise in December 2025 After Subdued Period
summary: Davis Index data showed U.S. recycled steel bids rose in December after a subdued May–November period, with prime grades up about $10/ton and some shredded and heavy melting scrap up $20/ton versus November; export prices for No.1/No.2 HMS cargoes from New York to Turkey climbed from roughly $305/ton in early November to about $331 by Dec. 10. Analysts note an oversupply of billets and slabs from China tempering activity in Turkey and India, while measures in the EU and other markets have tried to limit low-cost Chinese exports.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Trading Economics reports benchmark steel price moves with steel at 3,060 CNY/ton on Dec 17 and 3,086 CNY/ton on Dec 18, noting month-to-month small gains but year-on-year weakness; recent commentary highlights rebar futures volatility driven by demand uncertainty in China and hopes for macro support and potential rate cuts. The page provides charted historical data and short market notices such as a Dec.15 note that rebar futures hit a one-month low amid continued demand concerns in China.

title: Correction to EU flat steel price assessments on December 17
summary: Fastmarkets issued a correction to several EU flat-steel domestic price assessments published for Dec. 17, adjusting cold-rolled coil and galvanized coil ranges (e.g., cold-rolled coil ex-works Southern Europe corrected to €730–750/ton). The notice updates Fastmarkets’ pricing database and invites market participants to provide feedback or price submissions.

title: Steel Dynamics forecasts Q4 earnings of $1.65-$1.69 per share
summary: Steel Dynamics issued Q4 2025 guidance of $1.65–$1.69 per diluted share, attributing weaker sequential profitability to lower average selling values and reduced volumes driven by seasonal demand and extended maintenance outages that cut production by ~140–150k tons. The company noted recent improvements in flat-rolled steel prices as import volumes declined, while recycling and fabrication segments faced lower seasonal shipments and softer ferrous pricing.

title: US hot-rolled bar exports down 7.0 percent in August 2025
summary: SteelOrbis reports U.S. hot-rolled bar (rebar) export volumes fell year-on-year in August 2025, with rebar imports also notably lower in that month; the article is part of the site’s ongoing steel-news feed covering trade flows and market movements relevant to supply and price dynamics. The item highlights trade-volume changes that feed into broader pricing and market trend analysis.

title: US raw steel production is up 1.1 percent - week 51, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending December 13, 2025, reached 1.753 million net tons, up 1.1% from the previous week and 5.3% from the same week in 2024, with capacity utilization at 76.5%. Adjusted year-to-date production through December 13, 2025, was 85.881 million net tons at 76.8% capacity utilization, a 3.4% increase year-over-year.

title: India's iron ore production rises just 0.5% y-o-y in 8MFY'26 even as crude steel output jumps 11%
summary: India's iron ore production grew only 0.5% year-over-year in the first eight months of FY2026, lagging behind an 11% rise in crude steel output to 109.491 million tons, causing supply shortfalls and higher prices. JSW Steel saw a 32% drop to 11.2 million tons due to mine issues, while NMDC surged 21% to 31.5 million tons; industry groups call for policy changes to boost domestic supply.

title: Indian steelmakers face slower export outlook as new orders fade
summary: Indian steelmakers are facing a slower export outlook due to fading new orders. Steel production in the country grew by 6% amid these challenges.

title: Indian steel exports expected to moderate as global orders dry up
summary: Indian steel exports are expected to moderate in coming months as global orders dry up, according to Elara Capital. This follows slower growth in overseas demand.

title: Comex Copper Settles 1.45% Higher at $5.3635 — Data Talk
summary: Front‑month Comex copper for December delivery gained 7.65 cents per pound (1.45%) to settle at $5.3635, marking its largest one‑day dollar and percentage gain since Dec. 11, 2025; the piece notes copper is up roughly 34.6% year‑over‑year and remains below its 2025 high of $5.795 set in July 2025.[1] The report summarizes short‑term session performance, month‑to‑date and year‑to‑date moves and provides settlement‑price based statistics for market context.[1]

title: Glencore Acquires Peruvian Copper Project, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: SMM reports LME copper opened around $11,715/mt, fluctuated intraday and closed at $11,742.5/mt (up ~1.06%), with ample spot supply and average transactions noted on the spot market while end‑of‑year demand was weak; the note expects the price center to continue moving higher today and also highlights Glencore’s acquisition of a Peruvian copper project.[2] The bulletin also details domestic Chinese spot/import premiums, secondary copper indicators and macro commentary including Fed survey and Governor Waller remarks affecting expectations for rate cuts.[2]

title: Copper steadies near multi‑month highs as demand from China and US supports prices
summary: TradingEconomics reports copper futures around $5.35/lb, near multi‑month highs, supported by strong demand from China and the US—citing EV and energy infrastructure growth in China and AI‑driven investment in the US—while noting month and year gains of roughly 5–33% depending on the series.[3] The page also records a Dec. 16 note that copper rebounded on short covering and contract rollovers ahead of expiry, despite softer Chinese underlying data.[3]

title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Dec. 18
summary: Xinhua’s price snapshot at 0200 GMT lists copper at $5.36 per pound as part of a wider metals price update, providing a concise market quote to gauge intraday levels across exchanges.[4] The brief release is a data update rather than a narrative market analysis.[4]

title: Metals surge as rate‑cut hopes rise
summary: ShareCafe reports a broad base‑metals rally led by copper, driven by rising expectations for interest‑rate cuts and signals of tightening supply; the article highlights strong Chinese import figures and US AI infrastructure investment as demand drivers, while noting market participants are watching upcoming US economic data for Fed policy direction.[5] It frames the rally within broader precious‑ and base‑metals moves and commentary from ANZ on rate cuts benefiting the sector.[5]

title: Copper prices rise as market assesses US jobs data
summary: Hellenic Shipping News notes Shanghai Futures Exchange most‑traded copper rose ~0.49% to 92,720 yuan/mt, reporting that market participants were assessing US jobs data and its implications for Fed policy while prices climbed on risk‑on sentiment.[6] The piece provides local Chinese contract moves and frames them alongside macroeconomic data influences.[6]

title: Copper higher on potential mine shortfalls, risk‑on sentiment
summary: Business Recorder reports copper rose amid worries about potential mine shortfalls that spurred speculative buying, with the piece citing London‑based benchmark moves and general risk‑on market sentiment as drivers of the gains.[7] The article emphasizes supply concerns as a key near‑term influence on copper prices.[7]

title: Glencore Acquires Peruvian Copper Project, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Glencore has acquired a Peruvian copper project amid fluctuating LME copper prices, which opened at $11,715/mt overnight, reached a high of $11,821.5/mt, and closed at $11,742.5/mt, up 1.06%. The report covers spot prices in Guangdong, imported copper quotes, secondary copper premiums, and inventory changes at LME and SHFE, with LME stocks up slightly and SHFE down.

title: Post 35% Surge, Analysts Eye More Upside in Copper Giant Freeport
summary: Following a 35% stock surge, analysts are optimistic about Freeport-McMoRan due to expected recovery of copper production at its Grasberg mine to 90% of pre-mudslide levels in 2026 and full capacity in 2027. Long-term demand from EVs, which use three to four times more copper than gas vehicles, and data centers supports the outlook despite temporary disruptions.

title: Why ASX 200 Copper Focus Is Shifting After Sandfire's Project Reset
summary: ASX 200 copper sector attention is shifting following Sandfire Resources' project reset, signaling changes in production or development strategies for copper assets. The article discusses implications for investor focus amid ongoing copper market dynamics.

title: Rio Tinto’s Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto announced that its Nuton copper-processing technology has produced its first copper product; the company says Nuton will deliver materially lower environmental impacts versus conventional processing, including up to 80% less water use and up to 60% lower greenhouse‑gas intensity. The release frames Nuton as a scalable, lower‑footprint processing route intended to reduce water and emissions footprints for future copper projects.

title: Codelco & Hexagon sign MoU on collaboration from CAS to autonomy
summary: Chilean state miner Codelco and technology group Hexagon signed a memorandum of understanding to collaborate across Codelco Automation System (CAS) and autonomy initiatives aimed at improving operational efficiency and safety in copper operations. The partnership focuses on digitalization, autonomy and remote‑operation technologies to advance productivity and sustainability in large‑scale copper mining.

title: Capital demands soar for new copper supply
summary: S&P Global reported that bringing new copper supply online is becoming substantially more capital‑intensive, raising the cost and complexity of meeting rising demand driven by electrification and AI infrastructure. The analysis details rising weighted capital intensity for upcoming projects, project delays and higher development costs that together create sustainability and supply‑security challenges for the copper sector.

title: Introducing the Minerals Stewardship Consortium at MIT
summary: MIT launched the Minerals Stewardship Consortium to convene industry, academia and policy leaders to develop responsible, scalable strategies for critical‑minerals production and stewardship, including copper. The consortium will pursue systems‑level innovation—digital mining tools, environmental monitoring, and social/ecological integration—to reduce environmental and social impacts while enabling resilient copper supply chains.

title: Climate‑friendly metals from deep‑sea ores
summary: Max Planck researchers described a process reported in Science Advances for extracting copper, nickel and cobalt from deep‑sea manganese nodules using smelting and hydrogen reduction; the method reportedly reduces CO2 emissions by over 90% (when using green hydrogen) and cuts energy use by nearly 20% compared with conventional carbon‑based reduction. The team frames deep‑sea ore processing as a potentially lower‑impact source of metals needed for electrification, while noting broader environmental considerations of seabed mining.

title: On December 18, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price reached 113,100-120,100 yuan/mt on December 18, with an average of 116,600 yuan/mt, marking an increase of 1,300 yuan/mt from the previous day. This uptick reflects recent market movements in refined nickel pricing.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel prices were relatively weak this week, with sluggish spot transactions and continued inventory buildup
summary: Nickel prices remained weak this week due to loose supply and demand balance, despite the US Fed's interest rate cut, with SHFE nickel closing down 1.84% WoW at 115,590 yuan/mt and LME prices down 2.27% WoW. Spot transactions were sluggish, with SMM #1 refined nickel averaging 119,350 yuan/mt, down 1,850 yuan/mt WoW, amid ongoing inventory stability in the Shanghai Bonded Zone. Prices are expected to stay in the doldrums short-term, fluctuating around 112,000-117,000 yuan/mt for SHFE nickel.

title: Govt to revise nickel benchmark pricing, cobalt to face royalties: APNI
summary: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources plans to revise the nickel benchmark price formula in early 2026, introducing royalties on associated minerals like cobalt. APNI supports this, noting it could generate up to US$600 million in state revenue despite cobalt's low content in nickel ore, while urging focus on associated minerals over raising primary nickel royalties.
